de.polygonal.ds.BitVector

type
class
implements
Hashable

An array data structure that compactly stores individual bits (Boolean values).

Constructor

new(size : Int)

Creates a bit-vector capable of storing a total of size bits.

Instance Variables

key : Int

A unique identifier for this object.
A hash table transforms this key into an index of an array element by using a hash function.
This value should never be changed by the user.

Instance Methods

inline bucketSize() : Int

The total number of 32-bit integers allocated for storing the bits.

inline capacity() : Int

The exact number of bits that the bit-vector can store.

clone() : BitVector

Creates a copy of this bit vector.

inline clr(i : Int) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError index out of range (debug only).
Sets the bit at index i to 0.

inline clrAll() : Void

Sets all bits in the bit-vector to 0.

free() : Void

Destroys this object by explicitly nullifying the array storing the bits.

inline has(i : Int) : Bool

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError index out of range (debug only).
Returns true if the bit at index i is 1.

inline ofBool(i : Int, cond : Bool) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError index out of range (debug only) (debug only).
Sets the bit at index i to 1 if cond is true or clears the bit at index i if cond is false.

ofBytes(bytes : haxe.io.BytesData, ?bigEndian : Bool) : Void

parameters
bigEndian the input byte order (default is little endian)
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError input is null (debug only).
Copies the bits from bytes into this bit vector.
The bit-vector is resized to the size of bytes.

resize(x : Int) : Void

Resizes the bit-vector to x bits.
Preserves existing values if the new size > old size.

inline set(i : Int) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError index out of range (debug only).
Sets the bit at index i to 1.

inline setAll() : Void

Sets all bits in the bit-vector to 1.

inline size() : Int

The total number of bits set to 1.

toBytes(?bigEndian : Bool) : haxe.io.BytesData

parameters
bigEndian the byte order (default is little endian)
Writes the data in this bit-vector to a byte array.
The number of bytes equals bucketSize() * 4 and the number of bits equals capacity().

toString() : String

Returns a string representing the current object.
Prints out all elements if compiled with the -debug directive.
Example:

	  var bv = new de.polygonal.ds.BitVector(40);
	  for (i in 0...bv.capacity()) {
	      if (i & 1 == 0) {
	          bv.set(i);
	      }
	  }
	  trace(bv);
	  {BitVector, set/all: 20/40}
	  |<
	    0 -> b01010101010101010101010101010101
	    1 -> b00000000000000000000000001010101
	  >|
